title: Your Friday Briefing: U.FO.s Were Likely Not Spying, Biden Says
description: Also, New Zealand’s recovery from Cyclone Gabrielle and a disturbing conversation with a chatbot.

title: Belarus Would Join Russia’s War if Ukraine Attacked, Lukashenko Says
description: President Aleksandr Lukashenko of Belarus has been surrounded by speculation that his country could be pressed into providing more support for Russia.

title: Balloons Are Latest Example of Old Tactics Used in Ukraine War
description: The Soviet military often used unpowered balloons before World War II, and they made a resurgence in the Cold War. Now they’re being used in the Ukraine war, along with other low-tech devices.

title: If Scotland’s Admired Leader Could Not Deliver Independence, Can Anyone?
description: The separatist movement needs a new chief after the surprise resignation of Nicola Sturgeon, Scotland’s popular leader, but none of the contenders has anything like her stature.

title: Spain Allows Legal Gender Change Without a Medical Evaluation
description: A new law will allow people 16 and older to change their registered gender without undergoing psychological and medical evaluations to show gender dysphoria.

title: Arne Treholt, 80, Dies; Norwegian Diplomat Convicted of Spying for Soviets
description: In one of the biggest espionage scandals of the Cold War, he handed over NATO plans and other secrets. He was sentenced to 20 years in prison.

title: Nicola Sturgeon Resigns: What to Know, and What’s Next for Scotland
description: The decision by Ms. Sturgeon to step down as the country’s leader came as a shock. What is her legacy, and why did she quit?

title: Behind China’s Balloons, a Push for Business to Serve the Military
description: The Chinese government has tried to meld its military and civilian innovation, prompting a backlash from the United States.

title: ‘This Is a Secret’
description: A Times columnist spoke with a chatbot powered by artificial intelligence. It didn’t go well.

title: Russia Attacks Infrastructure After Apparent Attempt to Distract Ukraine’s Air Defenses
description: Russia launched a predawn assault with missiles and drones. The attacks came hours after Moscow floated balloons over Kyiv, in what Ukrainian officials said was a tactic to “confuse” defense systems. Here’s what we’re covering today:

title: Divided Views of Nicola Sturgeon Among Scots Reflect Wider Political Schism
description: Nicola Sturgeon’s resignation was a moment for voters to take stock of her eight years as first minister and reflect on what may come next.

title: New Zealand, Battered by a Record Storm, Faces a Painful Cleanup
description: Five people were dead and thousands were still unaccounted for after Cyclone Gabrielle lashed the North Island.

title: Syria’s Assad Uses Disaster Diplomacy to Inch Back Onto World Stage
description: “A tragedy for Syrians is a boon for Assad because nobody else wants to manage this mess,” one analyst said of President Bashar al-Assad, who became a global pariah for his regime’s abuses during a civil war.

title: After News Anchor’s Long Career, She Found Herself Focus of the Story
description: Lisa LaFlamme was dismissed after a decades-long TV career, not long after she stopped dyeing her hair, setting off debates across Canada about sexism, ageism and going gray.

title: Waffles, Gentle Slopes and Cloudberries Everywhere: Skiing in Sälen, Sweden
description: Gstaad it’s not, but this snowy region within driving distance of Stockholm has welcoming cabins deep in the forest, trails for every level of skier and a possibility of gnomes.

title: Russia Has Lost Half Its Tanks in Ukraine War, Report Says
description: A report by the International Institute for Strategic Studies said Russia’s tank and artillery fleets had suffered “significant attrition” in the war.

title: Scientists Wondered if Warming Caused Argentina’s Drought. The Answer: No.
description: Climate change didn’t make the dry spell more likely, researchers found, though extreme heat probably made it hurt more.

title: Thousands of Chinese Retirees Protest Government Cuts to Benefits
description: The protest in Wuhan highlights the strain on the finances of local governments, made worse by heavy spending on “zero Covid” measures.

title: Your Thursday Briefing
description: The limitations of Russia’s military.

title: ‘The World’s Largest Construction Site’: The Race Is On to Rebuild Ukraine
description: As the country’s leaders lay postwar plans, companies from around the world are jockeying for advantage in what could be a multibillion-dollar effort, although one loaded with risk.

title: Moscow’s Military Capabilities Are in Question After Failed Battle for Ukrainian City
description: A disastrous Russian assault on Vuhledar, viewed as an opening move in an expected spring offensive, has renewed doubts about Moscow’s ability to sustain a large-scale ground assault.

title: Ukraine Says It Shot Down Russian Balloons Over Kyiv
description: Russia “uses such flying objects for reconnaissance or to confuse air defense systems,” the spokesman for the Ukrainian air force said.
